comment._content: RA2 CYI 637 Leyland PD3/2 582521 - CIE H41/33R new 3/59; w/d 12/81 and scrapped 8/82 RA3 CYI 638 Leyland PD3/2 581755 - CIE H41/33R new 3/59; w/d 12/81 and scrapped 11/82 The 002 ZJ is a "garage" plate. yep. Ready for action...23years to go Classic Irish Buses

comment.author: 38401430@N06
comment._content: RA2 & 3 are seen when brand new at Broadstone and they are being prepared for service which explains why they have no destination blinds in place. The "garage" plate is actually called a "trade plate" and is used for moving untaxed vehicles for testing or maintenance work. There were 152 vehicles in the "RA" class so they were a very common sight in Dublin. At least one member of the class was destroyed by terrorists in May 1974 when it was set on fire at Rathfarnham:

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/38401430@N06] They were called Garage Plates back then. :) oireachtasdebates.oireachtas.ie/debates%20authoring/debat...

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content:
CTI???  At first glance I thought I saw a Limerick licence plate!  I cannot remember seeing one of those in my life on a CIE bus but then again I wasn't paying much attention when I was trying to scut along on the back platform!  Those buses were a mixed blessing with the open back giving ease of access and built in air conditioning all year round:-)
I went up to Broadstone once in 1968 when a bus strike was ongoing and was given an interrogation into the finer points of the criminal law.  After being nonplussed for a few moments I realised that I was in the presence of a legend named Lonzo Lou who was CIE's investigator and a former Garda Sergeant.

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] These buses are the two tone green. RA137 was the first painted in the blue & cream livery, which was later applied to all double deck buses on overhaul, as well as new buses up to 1974. Up to 1961, all DUTC and then CIE buses were green. Single deck livery was changed to red in 1960.
